intro: Psychotria brevinodis, commonly known as the "Amazonian arrow poison plant," is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant contains alkaloids, including the psychoactive compound dimethyltryptamine (DMT), which has been traditionally used by indigenous peoples. Its roots and leaves are often processed to produce a potent poison used in hunting. Due to its chemical composition, it has attracted scientific interest for both its medicinal and ethnobotanical significance.
